CHAT: Chat with your collaborator by typing in this box!
AUTH: Please authorize this app to enable your work to be saved and to allow it to be shared by you.
COLOUR_PICKER_TOOLTIP: Choose a colour from the palette.
COLOUR_BLEND_TOOLTIP: Blends two colours together with a given ratio (0.0 - 1.0).
CONTROLS_WHILEUNTIL_TOOLTIP_WHILE: While a value is true, then do some statements.
CONTROLS_WHILEUNTIL_TOOLTIP_UNTIL: While a value is false, then do some statements.
CONTROLS_FOR_TOOLTIP: Have the variable '%1' take on the values from the start number as long as it is less than the end number, counting by the specified interval, and do the specified blocks.
CONTROLS_FOR_TITLE: count with %1 from %2 while counter < %3 by %4
CONTROLS_FOREACH_TOOLTIP: For each item in a list, set the variable '%1' to the item, and then do some statements.
CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_OPERATOR_CONTIN: continue with next iteration of loop
CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_TOOLTIP_BREAK: Break out of the containing loop.
CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_TOOLTIP_CONTINU: Skip the rest of this loop, and continue with the next iteration.
CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_WARNING: Warning: This block may only be used within a loop.
CONTROLS_IF_TOOLTIP_1: If a value is true, then do some statements.
CONTROLS_IF_TOOLTIP_2: If a value is true, then do the first block of statements. Otherwise, do the second block of statements.
CONTROLS_IF_TOOLTIP_3: If the first value is true, then do the first block of statements. Otherwise, if the second value is true, do the second block of statements.
CONTROLS_IF_TOOLTIP_4: If the first value is true, then do the first block of statements. Otherwise, if the second value is true, do the second block of statements. If none of the values are true, do the last block of statements.
CONTROLS_IF_IF_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder sections to reconfigure this if block.
CONTROLS_IF_ELSEIF_TOOLTIP: Add a condition to the if block.
CONTROLS_IF_ELSE_TOOLTIP: Add a final, catch-all condition to the if block.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_EQ: Return true if both inputs equal each other.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_NEQ: Return true if both inputs are not equal to each other.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_LT: Return true if the first input is smaller than the second input.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_LTE: Return true if the first input is smaller than or equal to the second input.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_GT: Return true if the first input is greater than the second input.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_GTE: Return true if the first input is greater than or equal to the second input.
LOGIC_OPERATION_TOOLTIP_AND: Return true if both inputs are true.
LOGIC_OPERATION_TOOLTIP_OR: Return true if at least one of the inputs is true.
LOGIC_NEGATE_TOOLTIP: Returns true if the input is false. Returns false if the input is true.
LOGIC_TERNARY_TOOLTIP: Check the condition in 'test'. If the condition is true, returns the 'if true' value; otherwise returns the 'if false' value.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_ADD: Return the sum of the two numbers.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_MINUS: Return the difference of the two numbers.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_MULTIPLY: Return the product of the two numbers.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_DIVIDE: Return the quotient of the two numbers.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_POWER: Return the first number raised to the power of the second number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_ROOT: Return the square root of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_ABS: Return the absolute value of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_NEG: Return the negation of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_LN: Return the natural logarithm of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_LOG10: Return the base 10 logarithm of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_EXP: Return e to the power of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_POW10: Return 10 to the power of a number.
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_SIN: Return the sine of a degree (not radian).
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_COS: Return the cosine of a degree (not radian).
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_TAN: Return the tangent of a degree (not radian).
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_ASIN: Return the arcsine of a number.
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_ACOS: Return the arccosine of a number.
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_ATAN: Return the arctangent of a number.
MATH_CONSTANT_TOOLTIP: Return one of the common constants: π (3.141…), e (2.718…), φ (1.618…), sqrt(2) (1.414…), sqrt(½) (0.707…), or ∞ (infinity).
MATH_IS_TOOLTIP: Check if a number is an even, odd, prime, whole, positive, negative, or if it is divisible by certain number. Returns true or false.
MATH_ROUND_TOOLTIP: Round a number up or down.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_SUM: Return the sum of all the numbers in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_MIN: Return the smallest number in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_MAX: Return the largest number in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_AVERAGE: Return the average (arithmetic mean) of the numeric values in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_MEDIAN: Return the median number in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_MODE: Return a list of the most common item(s) in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_STD_DEV: Return the standard deviation of the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_RANDOM: Return a random element from the list.
MATH_MODULO_TOOLTIP: Return the remainder from dividing the two numbers.
MATH_CONSTRAIN_TOOLTIP: Constrain a number to be between the specified limits (inclusive).
MATH_RANDOM_INT_TOOLTIP: Return a random integer between the two specified limits, inclusive.
MATH_RANDOM_FLOAT_TOOLTIP: Return a random fraction between 0.0 (inclusive) and 1.0 (exclusive).
TEXT_TEXT_TOOLTIP: A letter, word, or line of text.
TEXT_JOIN_TOOLTIP: Create a piece of text by joining together any number of items.
TEXT_CREATE_JOIN_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder sections to reconfigure this text block.
TEXT_CREATE_JOIN_ITEM_TOOLTIP: Add an item to the text.
TEXT_APPEND_TOOLTIP: Append some text to the first text.
TEXT_LENGTH_TOOLTIP: Returns the number of letters (including spaces) in the provided text.
TEXT_ISEMPTY_TOOLTIP: Returns true if the provided text is empty.
TEXT_INDEXOF_TOOLTIP: Returns the index of the first/last occurrence of the first text in the second text. Returns 0 if text is not found.
TEXT_CHARAT_TOOLTIP: Returns the letter at the specified position.
TEXT_GET_SUBSTRING_TOOLTIP: Returns a specified portion of the text.
TEXT_GET_SUBSTRING_START_FROM_END: get substring from letter # from end
TEXT_CHANGECASE_TOOLTIP: Return a copy of the text in a different case.
TEXT_TRIM_TOOLTIP: Return a copy of the text with spaces removed from one or both ends.
TEXT_TRIM_OPERATOR_BOTH: trim spaces from both sides of
TEXT_TRIM_OPERATOR_LEFT: trim spaces from left side of
TEXT_TRIM_OPERATOR_RIGHT: trim spaces from right side of
TEXT_PRINT_TOOLTIP: Print the specified text, number or other value.
TEXT_PROMPT_TOOLTIP_NUMBER: Prompt for user for a number.
TEXT_PROMPT_TOOLTIP_TEXT: Prompt for user for some text.
LISTS_CREATE_EMPTY_TOOLTIP: Returns a list, of length 0, containing no data records
LISTS_CREATE_WITH_TOOLTIP: Create a list with any number of items.
LISTS_CREATE_WITH_CONTAINER_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder sections to reconfigure this list block.
LISTS_CREATE_WITH_ITEM_TOOLTIP: Add an item to the list.
LISTS_REPEAT_TOOLTIP: Creates a list consisting of the given value repeated the specified number of times.
LISTS_REPEAT_TITLE: create list with item %1 repeated %2 times
LISTS_LENGTH_TOOLTIP: Returns the length of a list.
LISTS_ISEMPTY_TOOLTIP: Returns true if the list is empty.
LISTS_INDEX_OF_TOOLTIP: Returns the index of the first/last occurrence of the item in the list. Returns -1 if item is not found.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_FROM_START: Returns the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the first item.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_FROM_END: Returns the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the last item.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_FIRST: Returns the first item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_LAST: Returns the last item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_RANDOM: Returns a random item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_REMOVE_FROM_: Removes and returns the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the first item.
Removes and returns the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the last item.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_REMOVE_FIRST: Removes and returns the first item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_REMOVE_LAST: Removes and returns the last item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_REMOVE_RANDO: Removes and returns a random item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_FROM_STAR: Removes the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the first item.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_FROM_END: Removes the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the last item.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_FIRST: Removes the first item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_LAST: Removes the last item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_RANDOM: Removes a random item in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_FROM_START: Sets the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the first item.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_FROM_END: Sets the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the last item.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_FIRST: Sets the first item in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_LAST: Sets the last item in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_RANDOM: Sets a random item in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_FROM_STAR: Inserts the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the first item.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_FROM_END: Inserts the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the last item.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_FIRST: Inserts the item at the start of a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_LAST: Append the item to the end of a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_RANDOM: Inserts the item randomly in a list.
LISTS_GET_SUBLIST_TOOLTIP: Creates a copy of the specified portion of a list.
LISTS_SORT_TOOLTIP: Sort a copy of a list.
LISTS_SPLIT_TOOLTIP_SPLIT: Split text into a list of texts, breaking at each delimiter.
LISTS_SPLIT_TOOLTIP_JOIN: Join a list of texts into one text, separated by a delimiter.
VARIABLES_GET_TOOLTIP: Returns the value of this variable.
VARIABLES_SET_TOOLTIP: Sets this variable to be equal to the input.
PROCEDURES_DEFNORETURN_TOOLTIP: Creates a function with no output.
PROCEDURES_DEFRETURN_TOOLTIP: Creates a function with an output.
PROCEDURES_DEF_DUPLICATE_WARNING: Warning: This function has duplicate parameters.
PROCEDURES_CALLRETURN_TOOLTIP: Run the user-defined function '%1' and use its output.
PROCEDURES_MUTATORCONTAINER_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder inputs to this function.
PROCEDURES_MUTATORARG_TOOLTIP: Add an input to the function.
PROCEDURES_IFRETURN_TOOLTIP: If a value is true, then return a second value.
PROCEDURES_IFRETURN_WARNING: Warning: This block may be used only within a function definition.
MOTOR_ON_TOOLTIP: Turns motor on with specific power.
MOTOR_ON_TOOLTIP_CALLIOPE: Turns motor A, B or A+B on with a specific power.
MOTORS_ON_TOOLTIP_CALLIOPE: Turns motor A and B on with a specific power.
MOTOR_ON_TOOLTIP_CALLIOPE_CB: Turns left or right motor on with a specific power. Power can be positiv or negativ for reverse direction.
MOTORS_ON_TOOLTIP_CALLIOPE_CB: Turns both motors on with a specific power. Power can be positiv or negativ for reverse direction.
SINGLE_MOTOR_ON_TOOLTIP_CALLIOPE: Turns the single motor on with a specific power. Power can be positiv or negativ for reverse direction.
MOTOR_ON_FOR_TOOLTIP: Turns motor on and stops motor after execution of rotations/degrees.
MOTOR_ON_FOR_TOOLTIP_MS: Turns motor on and stops motor after execution after time has passed.
MOTOR_ON_FOR_TOOLTIP_RPM: Turns motor on at speed in rpms (rotation per minute) and stops motor after execution of rotations/degrees.
MOTOR_ON_FOR_TOOLTIP_SERVO: Sets the servo motor to a specific position in degrees.
MOTOR_ON_FOR_TOOLTIP_STEPPER_FESTOBIONIC: Sets the stepper motor to a specific position in rotations.
STEP_MOTOR_ON_TOOLTIP: Turns motor on with a provided speed in rpm and stops motor after execution of provided number of rotations.
MOTOR_GETPOWER_TOOLTIP: Gets current power of this motor.
MOTORS_STOP_TOOLTIP: Stops both motors, A and B.
MOTORDIFF_ON_TOOLTIP: Starts the robot with specific speed.
MOTORDIFF_ON_FOR_TOOLTIP: Starts the robot with specific speed and stops after specific distance.
MOTORDIFF_TURN_FOR_TOOLTIP: Turns the robot for number of degrees.
MOTOROMNI_CURVE_TOOLTIP: Starts the robot with the combined speed of specific speeds in three directions [0;100].
MOTOROMNI_CURVE_FOR_TOOLTIP: Starts the robot with the combined speed of specific speeds in two directions [0;100] and stops after a specific distance.
MOTOROMNI_POSITION_TOOLTIP: Drives the robot to a specific coordinate given by the odometry data with a specific speed.
DISPLAY_PICTURE_TOOLTIP: Displays a picture on the screen.
DISPLAY_TEXT_TOOLTIP: Displays a text on the screen.
DISPLAY_PRINTLN_TOOLTIP: Displays a text on the screen in a new line.
PLAY_TONE_TOOLTIP: Plays a tone. Use frequency and duration to determine the tone pitch and duration.
BRICKLIGHT_RESET_TOOLTIP: Resets bricklight. Sets the default bricklight: green and blinking.
START_TOOLTIP: The starting point for the main program.
WAIT_TOOLTIP: Waits for a condition becoming true.
IF_TOOLTIP: Checks the condition in »if«. If the condition is true, executes the »do« action.
GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from chosen sensor.
ULTRASONIC_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the ultrasonic sensor in cm. Maximum distance to measure is 255 cm.
COLOUR_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the colour sensor.
COLOUR_COLOUR_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current colour reading from the sensor.
COLOUR_LIGHT_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current brightness reading from the sensor.
COLOUR_AMBIENTLIGHT_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current ambient light reading from the sensor.
COLOUR_RGB_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current colour reading from the colour sensor. Values are in the range 0 to 255.
INFRARED_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the infrared sensor.
INFRARED_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP_MBOT: Gets the current reading from the light sensor -- if a black line is detected (true/false).
ENCODER_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the motor encoder.
SENSOR_RESET_TOOLTIP_EDISON: Resets the sensors and clears the values.
GYRO_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the gyro sensor.
SENSOR_GYRO_TILTED_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP_WED: Is the tilt sensors position the indicated manner?
FLAME_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the flame sensor.
TIMER_SET_TOOLTIP: Sets the timer to defined period in milliseconds.
TIMER_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the timer.
BATTERY_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current voltage from the battery.
HTCOLOUR_TOOLTIP: Represents a HiTechnic NXT Color Sensor V2.
IRSEEKER_TOOLTIP: Represents a HiTechnic NXT IRSeeker V2 sensor.
PROCEDURES_VARIABLES_ERROR: Error: This block may be used only within the »
PROCEDURES_VARIABLES_LOOP_ERROR: Error: This block may be used only within a loop which declares '
SENSOR_PARTICLE_PM25_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Reads the current value of PM2.5 from the particle sensor.
SENSOR_PARTICLE_PM10_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Reads the current value of PM10 from the particle sensor.
SENSOR_TAP_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns 1 if a tap is detected else 0.
CONNECTION_START_TOOLTIP: Tries to make a connection to another robot via Bluetooth.
CONNECTION_WAIT_TOOLTIP: Waits for a connection via Bluetooth.
CONNECTION_RECEIVE_TOOLTIP: Waits for a message from the robot which you declare in the connection.
CONNECTION_CHANNEL_RECEIVE_TOOLTIP: Receive the last message sent to the specified channel.
CONNECTION_SEND_TOOLTIP: Sends a message to another robot.
CONNECTION_CHANNEL_SEND_TOOLTIP: Sends a message to another robot over the specified channel.
CONNECTION_CHECK_TOOLTIP: Check if the connection to the robot is active.
MBUILD_PORT_TOOLTIP: Block for the mBuild Port. The order of the compatible mbuild sensor blocks should be identical to the real system.
POPUP_ABOUT_TEXT: The Open Roberta Lab is a cloud-based integrated programming environment that enables children and adolescents to program easily different robot/microcontroller systems. This platform is completely open source so taking part is desirable! Both the software and the open source developer tools are available via Fraunhofer servers.
POPUP_ABOUT_TEXT_DEV: The Open Roberta Lab is an open-source programming platform developed by Fraunhofer IAIS within the initiative »Roberta – Learning with Robots«
POPUP_ABOUT_TEXT_GOOG: Open Roberta was initiated in collaboration with Google Germany to reduce the hurdles for students, teachers and schools programming educational robots.
POPUP_ABOUT_TEXT_NRW: As part of the project »AI Algorithms in Computer Science Education«, the Ministry for Schools and Education of the State of North Rhine-Westphalia is funding the integration of Artificial Neural Networks into the Open Roberta Lab as well as the development of suitable learning content and materials on Artificial Intelligence.
POPUP_STARTUP_HIDE: Okay, don't show this window again and remember my choice with a bookmark.
POPUP_STARTUP_COOKIES: We use cookies to personalise content and to analyse our traffic.
POPUP_ROBOT_NOT_CONNECTED: You have to make a connection to your robot first.
POPUP_CONFIRM_DELETE_PROGRAM:
Do you really want to delete the following program or programs?

If you delete a program you share with others, you delete it for everyone.

If you delete a program shared with you, you do not delete the program but the sharing.

If you delete a program with the owner »Gallery«, you remove your program from the gallery!
POPUP_CONFIRM_DELETE_CONFIGURATION: Do you really want to delete the configuration ?
POPUP_BEFOREUNLOAD: You have unsaved changes in your program or configuration. Sign in and save your program or configuration.
POPUP_BEFOREUNLOAD_LOGGEDIN: You have unsaved changes in your program or configuration.
POPUP_CONFIRM_UPDATE_FIRMWARE: There is a new firmware version for your robot available. You can try to run programs with the old version, but best bet is to update your robot now! You just have to click »Update now«.
POPUP_RUN_NOTIFICATION: To be able to transfer your program to your robot / microcontroller, connect it to the Open Roberta Lab. How to do this is explained in our Open Roberta Wiki under »Set Up«.
MESSAGE_INVALID_NAME: Please fill in a correct name. A correct name begins with a letter and can only contain letters or numbers, max. length is 255.
MESSAGE_INVALID_CONF_NAME: Please fill in a correct name. A correct name begins with a letter and can only contain letters or numbers. The default name »[robot]basis« can't be used here.
MESSAGE_EDIT_START: Your program »$« will run in a moment!
MESSAGE_EDIT_SAVE_PROGRAM_AS: Your program has been saved as »$«
MESSAGE_EDIT_SAVE_CONFIGURATION_AS: Your configuration has been saved as »$«
MESSAGE_RESTART_ROBOT: Please reconnect the robot to the Open Roberta Lab.
MESSAGE_FIRMWARE_ERROR: The firmware of your robot is newer than that of the Open Roberta Lab. Please tell your server admin, that the server needs to be updated.
ORA_ACCESS_RIGHT_CHANGED: The shared right for user »$« is updated!
ORA_ACCESS_RIGHT_DELETED: The shared right for user »$« is deleted!
ORA_TOKEN_SET_ERROR_NO_ROBOT_WAITING:
Check if your robot is switched on and connected to the server.
If you have problems to do this, please have a look at our help pages.
ORA_TOOLBOX_ERROR_ID_INVALID: Toolbox name is not a valid identifier.
ORA_TOOLBOX_GET_ONE_ERROR_NOT_FOUND: The toolbox could not be found in the database.
ORA_TOOLBOX_SAVE_ERROR: An error has occurred while saving the toolbox.
ORA_TOOLBOX_DELETE_ERROR: An error has occurred while deleting the toolbox, please try it again!
ORA_TOOLBOX_SAVE_ERROR_NOT_SAVED_TO_DB: An error error has occurred while saving the configuration in the database.
ORA_CONFIGURATION_ERROR_ID_INVALID: Configuration name is not a valid identifier.
ORA_CONFIGURATION_GET_ONE_ERROR_NOT_FOUN: The robot configuration could not be found in the database.
ORA_CONFIGURATION_SAVE_ERROR_NOT_SAVED_T: An error error has occurred while saving the configuration in the database.
ORA_CONFIGURATION_SAVE_ERROR: An error has occurred while saving the robot configuration.
ORA_CONFIGURATION_DELETE_ERROR: An error has occurred while deleting the robot configuration, please try it again!
ORA_PROGRAM_CONFIGURATION_NOT_COMPATIBLE: Program is not compatible with the configuration
ORA_PROGRAM_ERROR_ID_INVALID: The name of your  program is already used by the system. Please choose another name and try it again!
ORA_PROGRAM_GET_ONE_ERROR_NOT_FOUND: The program »$« could not be found in the database.
ORA_PROGRAM_GET_ONE_ERROR_NOT_LOGGED_IN: You are not logged in, please log in with your username and password or create a new user.
ORA_PROGRAM_SAVE_ERROR_PROGRAM_TO_UPDATE: The program could not be found, so it is impossible to update it.
ORA_PROGRAM_SAVE_ERROR_NO_WRITE_PERMISSI: You don't have the permission to modify this program!
ORA_PROGRAM_SAVE_ERROR_OPTIMISTIC_TIMEST: This program has been changed recently by someone else. You can save your changes in a new program, choose >save as< !
ORA_PROGRAM_DELETE_ERROR: An error error has occurred while deleting the configuration. Please try it again!
ORA_PROGRAM_IMPORT_ERROR: »$.xml« is not a valid NEPO program and cannot be uploaded!
ORA_USER_GET_ONE_ERROR_ID_OR_PASSWORD_WR: You have entered wrong user name or password. Please try again!
ORA_USER_CREATE_SUCCESS: Your user account »$« was successfully created!
ORA_USER_CREATE_ERROR_NOT_SAVED_TO_DB: The given user name already exists in the database, please choose another user name.
ORA_USER_DELETE_SUCCESS: Your account »$« was successfully deleted. Hope to see you soon again!
ORA_USER_DELETE_ERROR_NOT_DELETED_IN_DB: Error while deleting user in database.
ORA_COMPILERWORKFLOW_ERROR_PROGRAM_NOT_F: The program »$« could not be found in the database.
ORA_COMPILERWORKFLOW_ERROR_CONFIGURATION: The robot configuration could not be found on the server.
ORA_COMPILERWORKFLOW_ERROR_PROGRAM_TRANS: The program could not be transformed into the robots programming language.
ORA_COMPILERWORKFLOW_ERROR_CONFIGURATION: The robot configuration could not be transformed into the robots programming language.
ORA_COMPILERWORKFLOW_ERROR_PROGRAM_STORE: The program could not be saved because of an internal error.
ORA_COMPILERWORKFLOW_ERROR_PROGRAM_COMPI:
Your program has errors so it cannot be compiled. The compiler messages are:
{MESSAGE}
ORA_COMPILERWORKFLOW_ERROR_PROGRAM_GENER: The program could not be generated.
The program could not be generated. Pin {PIN} is incorrect in block {BLOCK}
ORA_ROBOT_NOT_WAITING: The robot does not wait for a run command.
ORA_ROBOT_PUSH_RUN: Robot waited and now the jar is pushed to the robot
ORA_ROBOT_FIRMWAREUPDATE_IMPOSSIBLE: An error has occurred while updating the new firmware on your robot.
ORA_ROBOT_NOT_CONNECTED:
There is no robot connected. Check if your robot is switched on, connect it to the server and type in the robot's password under robot - connect in the menu.
If you have problems to do this, please have a look at our help pages.
ORA_PROGRAM_TO_SHARE_DOES_NOT_EXIST: The program that you would like to share does not exist.
ORA_USER_TO_SHARE_DOES_NOT_EXIST:
The user with which you would like to share the program does not exist.
Try it again!
ORA_USER_TO_SHARE_SAME_AS_LOGIN_USER: You cannot share any programs with yourself.
ORA_USER_CREATE_ERROR_MISSING_REQ_FIELDS: Please make sure you have filled in all required fields! Your account couldn't be created.
ORA_USER_CREATE_ERROR_CONTAINS_SPECIAL_C: You are using some one or more special characters in your account name! Please remove them. Your account couldn't be created.
ORA_USER_CREATE_ERROR_ACCOUNT_LENGTH: Your account name or your user name is to long. Please make sure that they are not longer then 25 digits. Your account couldn't be created.
ORA_USER_EMAIL_ONE_ERROR_USER_NOT_EXISTS: This email address is unknown, maybe you have spelled it wrong!
ORA_ROBOT_DOES_NOT_EXIST:
It seems that we do not support the desired robot system!
Please choose another one.
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_SENSOR_MISSING: This sensor is not configured. Please add the corresponding block in the configuration tab!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_ACTOR_MISSING: This actuator is not configured. Please add the corresponding block in the configuration tab!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_WLAN_MISSING: WiFi is not configured. Please add the corresponding block in the configuration tab!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_SENSOR_WRONG: Connected wrong sensor to the given port!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_MOTOR_LEFT_MISSING: Left motor missing in the configuration!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_MOTOR_RIGHT_MISSING: Right motor missing in the configuration!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_MOTOR_MISSING: Motor is missing on the given port!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_OTHER_NOT_SUPPORTED: Other power consumer does not support this type of block!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_OVERLAPPING_PORTS: Another component is already using the same port!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_MISSING_PIN: The pin used by this component does not exist!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_NO_BUILTIN_RGBLED: This board does not have a built in RGB LED!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_DIFFDRIVE_NOT_UNIQUE: This configuration block may only occur once.
VALIDATION_SECOND_PASSWORD_EQUAL: The two passwords must be equal!
VALIDATION_VALID_EMAIL_ADDRESS: Please enter a valid email address!
SIM_BLOCK_NOT_SUPPORTED: Unfortunately you can not use this block in the simulation!
SIM_CONFIGURATION_WARNING_SENSOR_MISSING: This sensor is not in the configuration! The behaviour of the program on the real robot will be different than expected!
SIM_CONFIGURATION_WARNING_WRONG_SENSOR_P: In this block you have used a wrong sensor port! The behaviour of the program on the real robot will be different than expected, please check the robot configuration!
SIM_CONFIGURATION_WARNING_WRONG_INFRARED: The infrared sensor is not connected in the configuration! The behaviour of the program on the real robot will be different than expected, please check the robot configuration!
SERVER_NOT_AVAILABLE:
The Open Roberta Lab is currently not available.
Your internet connection was interrupted. If you currently have an EV3 connected via the USB cable solve this with a click on the programming environment.
If this problem persists please check your internet connection and try to reload this website. If you have this problem again, please don't hesitate to contact us via mail:
support-o-r@iais.fraunhofer.de
MENU_MESSAGE_DOWNLOAD: Your program has been successfully downloaded.
POPUP_PROGRAM_TERMINATED_UNEXPECTED: The execution of the program on the robot has terminated unexpectedly!
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION01:
Welcome,
click on »next« and start a tour through the Open Roberta Lab.
I'll show you how you can program your robot with NEPO.
You can end this tour all the time with a click on »X« in the right upper corner.
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION03:
Here you can find everything you need to program the robot!
Save and load programs
Connect your robot to the Open Roberta Lab or switch to another system
Help for all kinds of problems
Everything about user accounts, e.g. login or logoff
Look at the gallery and try great programs from other users!
Click here to switch to another language
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION04: Click here and switch to the robot configuration
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION05:
You can adapt the robot configuration later,
if you've constructed another robot.
If you don't have a robot and want to test your program in the simulation
this configuration is applied.
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION06: Click here and switch back to the programming area!
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION07:
The toolbox.
Here you can find all programming blocks.
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION07a:
Once you are an experienced user you can switch here to the expert mode of the toolbox.
You will then find more blocks to program your robot.
beginner mode
expert mode
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION08:
Each program starts with the »program start« block.
Further programming blocks, which the robot should execute, should be attached to this block.
Just drag'n drop the desired block right under the start block.
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION09:
Here you find some shortcuts!
From left to right:
Click here to execute the program on the real robot
Save your program, but before that you need to sign in
Click here and zoom in on the blocks, if you want to
The trashcan! Just move blocks into the trashcan and they will be deleted.
       Attention: You cannot recover blocks once they are deleted!
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION12: Now drag'n drop the new block just below the start-program-block so that they are connected
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION13a: and test your program in the simulation!
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION15:
Perfect,
your robot is driving 20 cm forward,
this is what you have programmed!
TOUR1_DESCRIPTION16: Bye and have fun trying out more!
LIGHT_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the light sensor in percent.
SOUND_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the sound sensor in the range 0 to 100. 0 is quiet and 100 is loud.
WRITE_TO_PIN_TOOLTIP: Sends the value to chosen pin.
PIN_SET_PULL_TOOLTIP: Sets the pull of the chosen pin
PIN_SET_PULL_BLOCK_WARNING: This block got replaced. Please use the 'Sensor digital'-block from the robotconfiguration
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_MOTORS_ROTATION_DIRE: The direction of rotation of the left and right motor is different!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_MULTIPLE_RIGHT_MOTOR: You have multiple right motors assigned to your configuration!
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_MULTIPLE_LEFT_MOTORS: You have multiple left motors assigned to your configuration!
WAIT_TIME_TOOLTIP: Waits for a certain time in milliseconds.
ORA_TOKEN_SET_ERROR_WRONG_ROBOTTYPE:
You are trying to connect a robot of a different type as selected in the menu.
Please switch the robot type in the robot's menu and try to connect again!
ORA_USER_ERROR_EMAIL_USED: There is already an account with this email address registered. Please enter another email address!
ORA_USER_ERROR_EMAIL_INVALID: There is a problem with your email address. Please try to write the email address lower case. If this doesn't help please contact our support
ORA_USER_PASSWORD_RECOVERY_EXPIRED_URL: The link is not valid anymore. Please ask for resetting your password again, if you still cannot remember it!
ORA_USER_PASSWORD_RECOVERY_SENT_MAIL_FAI: Sorry, we cannot send a mail to you, please contact »support-o-r@iais.fraunhofer.de«
ORA_USER_PASSWORD_RECOVERY_SENT_MAIL_SUC: We send a mail to you, please check your mailbox!
ORA_USER_UPDATE_SUCCESS: Your changes have been successfully saved!
COMPASS_TOOLTIP_EV3: Represents a HiTechnic NXT compass sensor.
COMPASS_CALIBRATE_TOOLTIP: Calibrates the compass. Turn the compass sensor VERY slowly for two times (about 40 seconds).
SOUND_RECORD_THYMIO_TOOLTIP: Start recording sounds on an SD Card connected to your Thymio. The recording is saved as a Rx.wav, where >>x<< is the name of the recording supplied. An SD Card is required!
SOUND_RECORD_STOP_TOOLTIP: Stop recording sounds to the SD Card.
SOUND_RECORD_DURATION_TOOLTIP: Get the duration of the recorded sound from the SD-Card.
MOTOR_ARDU_TOOLTIP: Represents a Bot'n Roll chassis motor.
NXTBRICK_TOOLTIP: Represents the NXT brick with connected actors and sensors. There are also inbuilt actors and sensors available, e.g. buttons, display ...
ARDUBRICK_TOOLTIP: Represents the Bot'n Roll board with connected actors and sensors. There are also inbuilt actors and sensors available, e.g. pushbuttons, display ...
EV3BRICK_TOOLTIP: Represents the EV3 brick with connected actors and sensors. There are also inbuilt actors and sensors available, e.g. buttons, display ...
SENSEBOXBRICK_TOOLTIP: Represents the senseBox. Please configure here the id's from the openSenseMap, if you want to use them.
ORA_PROGRAM_IMPORT_ERROR_WRONG_ROBOT_TYP:
You tried to import a program suitable for »$«, which is different from your menu selection.
Please switch the robot type in the robot's menu and try to import again!
SENSOR_GESTURE_TOOLTIP: Is the system in the selected state?
TEMPERATURE_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the temperature sensor in °C.
COMPASS_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the compass sensor.
MICROPHONE_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the microphone in % (mapped to 0 - 100). If the value is always low, the value has to be multiplied by 10, because the amplification is missing on the hardware.
CALLIOPEBRICK_TOOLTIP: Represents Calliope, a pocket-sized codeable computer. There are also inbuilt actors and sensors available, e.g. buttons, display ...
MICROBITBRICK_TOOLTIP: Represents micro:bit, a pocket-sized codeable computer. There are also inbuilt actors and sensors available, e.g. buttons, display ...
ACTION_PLAY_RECORDING_TOOLTIP_THYMIO: Play sound Rx.wav from the SD card, where >>x<< is the name of the recording supplied. An SD card is required!
LED_ON_TOOLTIP: Turns the LED on and changes the color.
LED_BUTTON_ON_TOOLTIP: Turns the various button LEDs on with the supplied brightness values. The percentage values range from 0% (off) to 100% (full brightness).
LED_CIRCLE_ON_TOOLTIP: Turns the various circle LEDs on with the supplied brightness values. The percentage values range from 0% (off) to 100% (full brightness).
LED_PROXV_ON_TOOLTIP: Turns the various distance sensor LEDs on with the supplied brightness values. The percentage values range from 0% (off) to 100% (full brightness).
LED_PROXH_ON_TOOLTIP: Turns the bottom sensor LEDs on with the supplied brightness values. The percentage values range from 0% (off) to 100% (full brightness).
LED_TEMPERATURE_ON_TOOLTIP: Turns the temperature sensor LEDs on with the supplied brightness values. The percentage values range from 0% (off) to 100% (full brightness).
LED_SOUND_ON_TOOLTIP: Turns the microphone LED on with the supplied brightness values. The percentage value range from 0% (off) to 100% (full brightness).
LED_ON_QUADRGB_TOOLTIP: Turns on the fill lights of the quad RGB sensor in the given color.
LED_ON_TOOLTIP_CB: Turns the LED on and changes the color. Attention: calli:Bot only supports 7 different colors, the nearest will be chosen.
RGB_LED_TOOLTIP: Turns the LED on or off and changes the color.
LED_ON_WHITE_TOOLTIP: Turns the LED on. Watch out, it's very bright!
SET_RELAY_TOOLTIP: Turns the relay on or off
LED_SET_BRIGHTNESS_TOOLTIP: Sets the brightness of all LEDs [0-100]
LED_OFF_QUADRGB_TOOLTIP: Turns off the fill lights of the quad RGB sensor
COLOUR_RGB_TOOLTIP: Creates a color with the given red, green, and blue values. Values should be between 0 and 255.
IMAGE_TOOLTIP: Creates an image for the display. You can specify the brightness of each pixel from 0 to 9 or # where 0 means no light, 1 is a bit bright and 9 or # is the brightest value.
IMAGE_INVERT_TOOLTIP: Inverts the image. Each pixel with value 0 or none will be set to # or 9 and pixels with value # or 9 will be set to 0 or none.
IMAGE_SHIFT_TOOLTIP: Shifts the image in the given direction by the given number
ACCELERATION_TOOLTIP: Get the acceleration value in milli-gravities.
ACCELEROMETER_ROTATION_TOOLTIP: Get the tilt or rotations in degrees.
POPUP_DOWNLOAD_STEP_1: Right click on your program link below and
POPUP_DOWNLOAD_STEP_3: click on your connected »$« in the left column,
POPUP_DOWNLOAD_STEP_4:
now click on the »Save« button on the bottom right.
If your program doesn't start automatically press the reset button after a while.
POPUP_DOWNLOAD_CHECK: Okay, I've changed the download folder of my browser permanently. Don't show this popup again and download my programs directly.
POPUP_DOWNLOAD_STEP_1_SENSEBOX: Check that your device is in programming mode (LED dimming in a pattern), if not, double press the red button. Right click on you program link below and
POPUP_DOWNLOAD_STEP_4_SENSEBOX: now click on the »Save« button on the bottom right.
POPUP_DOWNLOAD_STEP_1_EDISON: Connect your Edison via the EdComm cable and press the round button
POPUP_DOWNLOAD_STEP_2_EDISON: click on »Play« to play your program to Edison and
POPUP_DOWNLOAD_STEP_3_EDISON: wait until Edison beeps, then unplug.
POPUP_DOWNLOAD_STEP_4_EDISON:
Press the triangle button to start your program on your Edison
Having trouble? Turn up the volume and check that all sound enhancements are turned off
NAO_APPLYPOSTURE_TOOLTIP: Robot will take the selected posture or position. Use the dropdown menu to choose one.
NAO_STIFFNESS_TOOLTIP: The stiffness of the selected body part of the robot will be turned on or off. Be aware that releasing the leg motors while the robot is standing may result in robot collapsing.
NAO_AUTONOMOUS_TOOLTIP: Turn the robots autonomous behaviour on or off. While 'on' the robot will react to sounds, move slightly from side to side and try to track faces. Turn it off if this behaviour interrupts your program.
NAO_HAND_TOOLTIP: Open or close a single hand (wrist) of the robot.
NAO_MOVEJOINT_TOOLTIP: Move a single joint of the robot. A relative movement means that the current position of the selected joint is used to calculate the new position. Be aware that every joint has different limits. Therefore the input range for the degerees varies.
NAO_WALK_TOOLTIP: Makes the robot walk a distance entered in cm. Distances below 10cm might lead to no movement at all. Depending on your robot and the surface the robots is walking on the distance might not be exact.
NAO_TURN_TOOLTIP: Turns the robot for number of degrees. Only enter positive values and use the dropdown to select the direction. It is possible to enter values up to 360 degrees.
NAO_WALKTO_TOOLTIP: The robot walks to the given position. The values are entered in cm and radians and are based on the coordinate system in NAOs body. Please refer to the wiki for more information on the coordinate system and how to calculate the coordinates.
NAO_STOP_TOOLTIP: The robot immediately stops all movement. Be aware that this can lead to situations where downfall is possible.
NAO_ANIMATION_TOOLTIP: Perform the selected animation. TaiChi is a complex and artistic set of moves. Blink will only make the robot blink by using its LEDs. The wink and wipe forehead animation can be performed while siting and standing.
NAO_POINTLOOKAT_TOOLTIP: Robot points or looks at a given position. The robot will move one of its hands or the head. Select the frame that is the point of reference. The values are entered in centimeter. Refer to the wiki for more information about the coordinate systems.
NAO_SETVOLUME_TOOLTIP: Set the volume in a range from 0 to 100.
NAO_GETLANGUAGE_TOOLTIP: Get the active language. This is the language the robot is currently using for Text to Speech and Voice recognition.
NAO_SETLANGUAGE_TOOLTIP: Set the language. Be aware that it is necessary to download the language pack before you can use it. For more information refer to the manual of your robot.
SAY_TOOLTIP: The robot says the given text. It is also possible to enter special charaters. The robot will use the selected language to try and speak the entered text.
SAY_PARAMETERS_TOOLTIP: The robot says the given text. It is also possible to enter special charaters. The robot will use the selected language to try and speak the entered text. Modify the speed (range: 0-100) and the pitch of the voice (range: 0-100) with the input fields
NAO_PLAYFILE_TOOLTIP: Plays a sound file from the robot. Enter the name of the file. The file needs to be transferred to the robot beforehand.
NAO_TAKEPICTURE_TOOLTIP: Takes a picture and saves it on the robot. Access the robots file system to view the picture.
NAO_RECORDVIDEO_TOOLTIP: Records a video and saves it on the robot. Access the robots file system to view the video.
NAO_LED_TOOLTIP: Set the color of selected LED(s). Eyes and feet LEDs are available.
NAO_SETINTENSITY_TOOLTIP: Set the intensity of selected LED(s) in a range from 0 to 100. Ears, head and chest LEDs are available
NAO_LEDRESET_TOOLTIP: Reset the selected LEDs to their original state regarding colour and intensity.
NAO_RANDOMEYES_TOOLTIP: The color of the eyes is changed randomly for a specified amount of time entered in milliseconds.
NAO_RASTA_TOOLTIP: The color of the eyes is changed between green, yellow and red for a specified amount of time entered in milliseconds.
NAO_TOUCHSENSOR_TOOLTIP: Is true if the selected touchsensor on the robot was touched.
NAO_GYROMETER_TOOLTIP: Get the current reading from the gyrometer in the given direction.
NAO_ACCELEROMETER_TOOLTIP: Get the current reading from the accelerometer in the given direction
FSR_TOOLTIP: Get the current reading from the force sensitive resistor under the feet of the robot.
NAO_LEARNFACE_TOOLTIP: Learn and save a face under a given name in the vision recognition database on the robot.
NAO_FORGETFACE_TOOLTIP: Delete a face previously saved under a given name from the vision recognition database on the robot.
MENU_CODE_DOWNLOAD_TOOLTIP: Download the source code of your program on the computer
MENU_CODE_REFRESH_TOOLTIP: Refresh the source code, if you have changed the NEPO Blocks.
MENU_SIM_START_TOOLTIP: Start your program in the simulation.
MENU_SIM_STOP_TOOLTIP: Stop your program in the simulation.
MENU_SIM_IMPORT_TOOLTIP: Upload your own simulation background image, it will be appended at the end of the background's list.
MENU_SIM_DELETE_OBJECT_TOOLTIP: Delete the selected obstacle / color area.
MENU_SIM_CHANGE_COLOR_TOOLTIP: Choose a color for the selected obstacle / color area.
MENU_DEBUG_STEP_BREAKPOINT_TOOLTIP: Step forward to the next breakpoint in the program.
MENU_DEBUG_STEP_OVER_TOOLTIP: Step Over to the next block in the program.
MENU_DEBUG_STEP_INTO_TOOLTIP: Step Into to the next block in the program.
MENU_RIGHT_SIM_DEBUG_TOOLTIP: Open/close the simulation view in debug mode.
DISPLAY_GET_PIXEL_TOOLTIP: Returns the brightness for this led. 0 means the led is turned off, 9 is the brightest value.
DISPLAY_SET_PIXEL_TOOLTIP: Sets the brightness for this led. 0 means the led is turned off, 9 is the brightest value. With x and y you can determine the position of the led you would like to change.
DISPLAY_GET_BRIGHTNESS_TOOLTIP: Returns the brightness for all leds of the display. 0 means all leds are turned off, 9 is the brightest value.
DISPLAY_SET_BRIGHTNESS_TOOLTIP: Sets the brightness for all leds of the display. 0 means all leds are turned off, 9 is the brightest value.
POPUP_STARTUP_TOUR_TEXT: Would you like to get started, but do not know exactly how? We will show you the first steps in an interactive tutorial.
POPUP_STARTUP_HELP_TEXT: In our detailed help, we will explain everything you need, from building instructions to frequently asked questions.
ORA_USER_GROUP_SAVE_AS_ERROR_USER_GROUP_: This user already belongs to the group
POPUP_CONFIRM_DELETE_GROUP: Do you really want to delete these groups?
POPUP_CONFIRM_DELETE_USER_GROUP: Do you really want to remove these users below from the current group?
PROGLIST_DELETE_ALL_TOOLTIP: Click here to delete all selected programs.
PROGLIST_DELETE_TOOLTIP: Click here to delete your program.
PROGLIST_SHARE_TOOLTIP: Click here to share your program with a friend.
PROGLIST_LOAD_TOOLTIP: Click here to load your robot configuration in the configuration environment.
CONFLIST_DELETE_ALL_TOOLTIP: Click here to delete all selected programs.
CONFLIST_DELETE_TOOLTIP: Click here to delete your robot configuration.
CONFLIST_LOAD_TOOLTIP: Click here to load your robot configuration in the configuration environment.
ORA_GALLERY_UPLOAD_SUCCESS: Your program »$« is now in the gallery!
ORA_GALLERY_UPLOAD_ERROR: Your program »$« couldn't be uploaded to the gallery, it seems as if it is already uploaded.
ORA_LIKE_SAVE_ERROR_EXISTS: You couldn't like program »$«. Maybe you have already liked it.
ORA_LIKE_DELETE_SUCCESS: You do not like program »$« anymore!
PROGLIST_SHARE_WITH_GALLERY: Do you really want to share your program with everybody? If you are not sure please check the question and answers here.
GALLERY_SHARED_ALREADY: You have already uploaded this program to the gallery. If you want to change it, look for the copy from the gallery and modify it. You can also remove it from the gallery while deleting the copy from the gallery.
POPUP_GET_LINK: Here is the link to your actual program. Please don't change it, it probably won't work anymore. It's already copied to your clipboard!</br>$
ORA_USER_ACTIVATION_SENT_MAIL_SUCCESS: We send a mail to you, please check your mailbox!
ORA_USER_ACTIVATION_SENT_MAIL_FAIL: Sorry, we cannot send a mail to you, please contact »support-o-r@iais.fraunhofer.de«
ORA_USER_ACTIVATION_SUCCESS: Your account is successfully verified! Please login!
ORA_ACCOUNT_NOT_ACTIVATED_TO_SHARE:
Your are not allowed to share. Please activate your account!
Further information ...
ORA_USER_DEACTIVATION_SUCCESS: Your account is currently not verified, please check your mailbox!
JOYSTICK_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading of one of the axes of the joystick
JOYSTICK_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP_MBOT2: Is the joystick moved into the specified direction or pressed?
SENSOR_PIN_ANALOG_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns the value from the specified analog pin. The value is between 0 and 1024.
SENSOR_PIN_DIGITAL_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns the value from the specified digital pin. The value is either HIGH »1« or LOW »0«.
SENSOR_PIN_PULSEHIGH_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns the pulse HIGH on a pin in microseconds or -1 if no complete pulse was received within the timeout.
SENSOR_PIN_PULSELOW_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns the pulse LOW on a pin in microseconds or -1 if no complete pulse was received within the timeout.
CONNECTION_MBED_RECEIVE_TOOLTIP: Reads a message over one of the channels (0 - 255). The default channel is 0.
CONNECTION_MBED_SEND_TOOLTIP: Sends a message to another system. You can specify a signal strength from 0 - 7, where 0 is very low and 7 is the strongests. The message is send over channel 0 unless you specify another one.
CONNECTION_SET_CHANNEL_TOOLTIP: Sets the channel for sending and receiving messages. Can be set from 0 to 255.
GET_CODE_TOOLTIP: Returns the value of the solderable code pad in the head piece. Values are in range 0-31.
VARIABLE_USED_BEFORE_DECLARATION: The variable is used before declaration.
ORA_PROGRAM_INVALID_STATEMETNS: There are errors in your program or configuration. Please check the messages.
HINT_USER_ACCOUNT: »IAmBotman« or »RobellaStracciatella«? Not everyone needs to know your real name. Think of a cool nickname that you can easily remember.
HINT_USER_PASSWORT: 12345 is no secure password. Rather think of a safe combination of numbers and letters that you will not forget.
HINT_USER_NAME: Enter your real name here if you like. This is just for you, no one else will see it.
HINT_USER_EMAIL:
This is voluntary! However, some functions of the lab are only available if you have verified your account by e-mail. You are younger than 16? Please ask your parents to help you out with one of their e-mail addresses.
Further information ...
HINT_USER_AGE: Are you under 16? Then please ask your parents to help you. They can specify their e-mail address to confirm your account.
SENSOR_ARM_TOOLTIP: Returns true, if the selected part of the arm is touched, otherwise false.
CONNECTION_RECEIVE_TOOLTIP_BOB3: Reads a message via the IR receiver. Only numbers can be received.
CONNECTION_SEND_TOOLTIP_BOB3: Sends a message of type number to another Bob3. Hold the Bob3's face to face!
BLOCK_NOT_EXECUTED: The exection of this block will have no effect!
BLOCK_NOT_SUPPORTED: This robot does not support this block!
MODE_NOT_SUPPORTED: The selected mode of this block is not supported by this system!
NO_CONST_NOT_SUPPORTED: Please use a constant instead of an expression here!
BLOCK_USED_INCORRECTLY: Unfortunately, this block cannot be used in this way.
BOB3_SAVENUMBER_TOOLTIP: The number to store should be an integer in the range of 0 to 255
NAO_RECOGNIZEWORD_TOOLTIP: Returns a word from the given list when recognized by NAO
POPUP_CONFIRM_CONTINUE: Press »OK« to discard your work. Press »Cancel« to stay here and save your work first.
MENU_SIM_POSE_TOOLTIP: Resets the positions of all robots and obstacles then clears all drawings.
ORA_USER_ACTIVATION_INVALID_URL: The link is not valid anymore. Please ask for resending your verification mail again
FLYOUT_VARIABLE_TEXT: You need a variable? Please declare it first with a click on the + sign at the »start« block.
NAO_MARK_GET_INFORMATION_TOOLTIP: Returns additional information about the given NAO mark in an array with following values: [XAngle, YAngle, XSize, YSize, Heading], please note that all values are given in camera angles.
NAO_FACE_GET_INFORMATION_TOOLTIP: Returns additional information about the given detected in an array with following values: [XAngle, YAngle, XSize, YSize, Heading], please note that all values are given in camera angles.
RADIO_GET_RSSI_TOOLTIP: Gets the RSSI of the last package.
INFRARED_DISTANCE_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current relative distance from the infrared sensor. The values are between 1 and 75 cm.
INFRARED_DISTANCE_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP_ROBO: Gets the current relative distance from the infrared sensor. The values are between 4 and 30 cm.
SENSOR_INFRARED_DISTANCE_GETSAMPLE_TOOLT: Gets the current relative distance from the infrared sensor. The values are between 1, close, and 10, further away.
INFRARED_PRESENCE_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns an array of measurements for the presence of a beacon.
TEXT_COMMENT_TOOLTIP: Write a comment to your code here, to make it easier for you and others to read and understand your code. It will also generate an inline comment in the generated source code
MENU_ROBOT_STOP_HINT_EV3: Press + buttons on the robot to abort the program!
MENU_ROBOT_STOP_HINT_NXT: Press button on the robot to abort the program!
SENSOR_ULTRASONIC_DISTANCE_GETSAMPLE_TOO: Gets the current reading from the ultrasonic sensor in cm. Maximum distance to messure is 400 cm.
Gets the current reading from the ultrasonic sensor in cm. Maximum distance to messure is 400 cm. Minimum distance to measure is 3 cm.
Gets the current reading from the ultrasonic sensor in cm. Maximum distance to messure is 300 cm. Minimum distance to measure is 3 cm.
SENSOR_QUADRGB_LINE_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns a number in the range of 0 to 15 where each number corresponds to a different line state
SENSOR_IRSEEKER_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the position of an infrared beacon.
SENSOR_IRSEEKER_RCCODE_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Receives a message from a remote control.
SENSOR_LIGHT_LIGHT_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP_EDI: Gets the current reading of the light sensor
SENSOR_TEMPERATURE_PRESSURE_GETSAMPLE_TO: Gets the current reading of the air pressure sensor in Pascal. Normal air pressure is 101325 Pascal.
SENSOR_RSSI_VALUE_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the signal strength from the last received message.
SENSOR_ACCELEROMETER_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns the acceleration value on the given axis in g
SENSOR_ACCELEROMETER_VALUE_GETSAMPLE_TOO: Returns the acceleration value on the given axis in the range from [-32, 32]
SENSOR_ACCELEROMETER_X_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns the acceleration value on the X axis in g. Can be in range from -4 g to 4 g.
SENSOR_ACCELEROMETER_Y_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns the acceleration value on the Y axis in g. Can be in range from -4 g to 4 g.
SENSOR_ACCELEROMETER_Z_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns the acceleration value on the Z axis in g. Can be in range from -4 g to 4 g.
SENSOR_GYRO_X_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP_ARDUINO: Returns the gyroscope output on the X axis in degrees per second. Can be in range from -2000 °/s to 2000 °/s.
SENSOR_GYRO_Y_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP_ARDUINO: Returns the gyroscope output on the Y axis in degrees per second. Can be in range from -2000 °/s to 2000 °/s.
SENSOR_GYRO_Z_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP_ARDUINO: Returns the gyroscope output on the Z axis in degrees per second. Can be in range from -2000 °/s to 2000 °/s.
SENSOR_ACCELEROMETER_X_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns the acceleration value on the X axis in g. Can be in range from -2 g to 2 g.
SENSOR_ACCELEROMETER_Y_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns the acceleration value on the Y axis in g. Can be in range from -2 g to 2 g.
SENSOR_ACCELEROMETER_Z_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns the acceleration value on the Z axis in g. Can be in range from -2 g to 2 g.
SENSOR_ODOMETRY_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns the current position on a specific axis in cm or the orientation. Odometry values are reset every program start.
SENSOR_ODOMETRY_RESET_TOOLTIP: Resets the current position on a specific axis or the orientation.
SENSOR_OPTICAL_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns the current reading for a optical sensors specific output cable.
SENSOR_GESTURE_UP_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns »true« if the posture is upright.
SENSOR_GESTURE_DOWN_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns »true« if the posture is down.
SENSOR_GESTURE_FACE_UP_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns »true« if the posture is face up.
SENSOR_GESTURE_FACE_DOWN_GETSAMPLE_TOOLT: Returns »true« if the posture is face down.
SENSOR_GESTURE_FREEFALL_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTI: Returns »true« if it is free falling.
ORA_ROBOT_PUSH_RUN_CALLIOPE2016: Your program »$« is downloaded to Calliope, press the reset button to start it!
ORA_ROBOT_PUSH_RUN_NXT: Your program »$« is downloaded to the NXT, start it on the robot!
ERROR_MISSING_RETURN: The function return value is missing!
DIFFERENTIALDRIVE_TOOLTIP: Represents two motors on a common axis controlled independetly.
ACTION_LCD_MBOT2_BRUSH_TOOLTIP: Change the color of the next display action
LCDI2C_TOOLTIP: Represents an LCD 1602 display with a soldered I²C module.
SSD1306I2C_TOOLTIP: Represents an I²C OLED SSD1306 display (addresses 128x64: 0x3D, 128x32: 0x3C)
OPTICAL_TOOLTIP: Represent an optical sensor also called reflected light sensor.
ODOMETRY_TOOLTIP: Represents the availability of odometry data.
SENSOR_MOISTURE_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the moisture sensor in percent.
SENSOR_POTENTIOMETER_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the potentiometer in volts (0-5V).
SENSOR_HUMIDITY_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the humidity sensor in percent.
SENSOR_MOTION_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the motion sensor (true/false).
SENSOR_DROP_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the drop sensor in percent.
SENSOR_PULSE_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the pulse sensor.
SENSOR_PULSE_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP_ARDUINO: Gets the current reading from the pulse sensor. The value is between 0 and 1023.
SENSOR_RFID_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the RFID reader.
SENSOR_FSR_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Get the current reading from the force sensitive resistor under the feet of the robot.
SENSOR_DETECTFACE_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Detect a face previously learned and saved.
SENSOR_DETECTMARK_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns one or an array of IDs (number) of the last detected NAO Mark(s). If no marks are detected, -1 or an array consisting of 1 element with value -1 is returned. For a list of NAO marks with corresponding numbers refer to the wiki.
SENSOR_DETECTMARK_IDALL_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTI: Returns a list IDs (number) of the currently detected marker(s). If no markers are detected, returns a list containing -1.
SENSOR_MARKERINF_TOOLTIP: Returns the position data as a list [x,y,distance] of a specific marker ID found in cm. If no markers are detected, returns a list of -1.
SENSOR_CAMERA_THRESHOLD_TOOLTIP: Sets the threshold for color filtering for the marker and color recognition.
SENSOR_COLOURBLOB_TOOLTIP: Returns information as a list [x, y, size] about the biggest found area of a color in a specific HSV-range in pixels.
SENSOR_CAMERA_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns the x-position in pixels of the left most point of a line or -1 if no line was found.
SENSOR_ELECTRICCURRENT_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Get the electric current from the motorboard in the selected joint.
FOURDIGITDISPLAY_TOOLTIP: Represents a Grove 4-Digit Display by Seeed
FOURDIGITDISPLAY_SHOW_TOOLTIP: Displays a number [0-9999] on the 4-Digit Display. Position [0-3] represents the starting position of the number
LEDBAR_TOOLTIP: Represents a Grove LED Bar v2.0 by Seeed.
LEDBAR_SET_TOOLTIP: Sets the specified LED [0-9] on the LED Bar to the given brightness [0-8].
LEDBAR_ULTRASONIC2_SET_TOOLTIP: Sets the specified LED [1-8] on the ultrasonic sensor 2 to the given brightness [0-100].
BRUSH_ON_TOOLTIP: Turns on the brush with RPM of the motor (0<=RPM<=10000)
SIDE_BRUSH_TOOLTIP: Turns the side brush on or off .
VACUUM_ON_TOOLTIP: Turns on the vacuum speed in procent
ACTION_SERIAL_PRINT_TOOLTIP: Show data on the Serial Monitor. You can find the Serial Monitor in the USB Programm on top, under View.
DIGITALIN_TOOLTIP: Represents any actuator connected to a digital pin.
DIGITALOUT_TOOLTIP: Represents any sensor connected to a digital.
ANALOGIN_TOOLTIP: Represents any actuator connected to an analog pin.
ANALOGOUT_TOOLTIP: Represents any sensor connected to an analog pin.
SENSOR_OUT_ANALOG_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns the value from the specified analog pin. The value is between 0 and 1024.
SENSOR_OUT_DIGITAL_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns the value from the specified digital pin. The value is either HIGH »1« or LOW »0«.
ACTOR_ANALOGIN_TOOLTIP: Writes an analog value (PWM wave) to a pin. Only values between 0 and 255 should be used
ACTOR_DIGITALIN_TOOLTIP: Writes a HIGH or a LOW value to a digital pin. Only the values HIGH »1« and LOW »0« should be used.
ORA_LIST_CREATE_WITH_ERROR: Error: This block may be used only within a variable declaration.
CONNECTION_RECEIVE_TOOLTIP_MBOT: Reads a message from the IR receiver. Only strings can be received.
CONNECTION_SEND_TOOLTIP_MBOT: Sends a message of type string to another mBot. Hold the mBots's face to face!
POPUP_MULTIPLE_ROBOTS: Select multiple programs for the simulation
POPUP_MULTROBOTS_NOPROGRAMS: Please create and store at least two programs which then can be executed each by a simulated robot!
SEND_DATA_TO_OSM_TOOLTIP: This block is used to send data from sensors to the openSenseMap. Please configure the IDs in the configuration prior to the usage of this block.
SENSOR_LIGHTVEML_LIGHT_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Reads the current value of the visible light sensor in lux. The value is between 0 to 220000 lux.
SENSOR_LIGHTVEML_UVLIGHT_GETSAMPLE_TOOLT: Reads the current value of the UV light sensor in μW/cm². The value is between 0 and more than 1000.
SWITCH_LED_MATRIX_TOOLTIP: Enables/Disables the LED matrix to use the dual purpose pins.
CONFIGURATION_ERROR_WLAN_CREDENTIALS_MIS: Missing WLAN credentials, please enter them in robot -> WLAN credentials ... !
POPUP_WLAN_SECURITY_INFORMATION: Please note that the data provided in this dialog window is private and will not be stored in the OpenRoberta lab; it will only be used for program creation and during the compilation process. Make sure that for each new session you enter these credentials again. Please keep in mind that exposing this information to public may pose security risks.
ACTION_PLOT_POINT_TOOLTIP: Plots a point with specified value (Y axis) at the specified tickmark (X axis).
ACTION_PLOT_CLEAR_TOOLTIP: Removes all the data from the plot.
TITLE: title
PROGRAM_ERROR_EXPRBLOCK_TYPECHECK: This expression is invalid. The type check failed.
ICON_BLOCKING_TOOLTIP: Blocking block! This blocks needs some time to be executed, so other's have to wait until it gives back the control to the caller function.
ORA_FIRMWARE_RESET_SUCCESS: Your original program will run in a moment!
SOURCE_CODE_EDITOR_PLACEHOLDER: Import current NEPO program or just start typing
SOURCE_CODE_EDITOR_CLOSE_CONFIRMATION: All your changes will be lost!
POPUP_CREATE_BOOKMARK: Create a browser bookmark now to save your robot selection!
POPUP_BACKGROUND_STORAGE: The Open Roberta Lab can automatically load your simulation background on your next visits. For this purpose, we will save data in the Local Storage on your computer. More information in our privacy policy.
MOTIONKIT_SINGLE_TOOLTIP: Sets the selected MotionKit motor/motors to the specified direction.
MOTIONKIT_DUAL_TOOLTIP: Sets each MotionKit motor to the specified direction.
MOTIONKIT_PIN_OVERLAP_WARNING: The MotionKit uses the pins P1, P2, A0, A1, C16 and C17, so please make sure no other configuration-block uses them!
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_SQUARE: Return the number multiplied by itself.
ORA_GROUP_TO_SHARE_DOES_NOT_EXIST:
You do not own a user group with the name you entered.
Try again with a different name!
ORA_GROUP_MEMBER_SHARE_RESTRICTION_EXCEE: You can only share programs with other members of your user group. The owner of your user group can automatically read your programs.
ORA_GROUP_ERROR_NAME_INVALID: The name of the user group is invalid. Please do not use special characters and enter at least one character.
ORA_GROUP_ERROR_MISSING_RIGHTS_TO_BE_GRO: You are not allowed to be a user group owner. Your account must have an validated email attached.
ORA_GROUP_GET_ONE_ERROR: There was an error while aquiring the user group. Please reload the menu and try again. If this error should persist, please contact our support.
ORA_GROUP_GET_ONE_ERROR_NOT_FOUND: Could not find a user group with the specified name.
ORA_GROUP_GET_ALL_ERROR: There was an error while aquiring the list of user groups. Please reload the menu and try again. If this error should persist, please contact our support.
ORA_GROUP_CREATE_ERROR: There was an error on creating the user group. Please try different inputs or try again later. If this error should persist, please contact our support.
ORA_GROUP_CREATE_ERROR_GROUP_LIMIT_REACH: You reached the limit of user groups. You can not have more than 100 user groups in total.
ORA_GROUP_CREATE_ERROR_GROUP_ALREADY_EXI: You already have a user group with the that name. Please enter another name.
ORA_GROUP_DELETE_ERROR: There was an error while deleting the user group. Please reload the user group list and try again. If this error should persist, please contact our support.
ORA_GROUP_DELETE_ERROR_GROUP_DOES_NOT_EX: Could not find a user group with the specified name. Please reload the list of your user groups and try again.
ORA_GROUP_DELETE_ERROR_GROUP_HAS_MEMBERS: One or more members of the user group have logged in in the past and created programs. In order to delete the user group, delete its members first.
ORA_GROUP_UPDATE_ERROR: There was an error while updating the user group. Please reload the user group list and try again. If this error should persist, please contact our support.
ORA_GROUP_UPDATE_ERROR_NOT_FOUND: Could not find a user group with the specified name. Please reload the current form and try again.
ORA_GROUP_UPDATE_ERROR_NOT_OWNER: Could not update the user group. You are not the owner of that group.
ORA_GROUP_ADD_MEMBER_ERROR: There was an error while adding new members the user group. Please reload the current form and try again. If this error should persist, please contact our support.
ORA_GROUP_MEMBER_ERROR_ALREADY_EXISTS: A member with the given name already exists in the user group.
ORA_GROUP_ADD_MEMBER_ERROR_LIMIT_REACHED: You can not have more than 99 members in one user group.
ORA_GROUP_ADD_MEMBER_ERROR_SMALLER_THAN_: To add automatically generated members, you must enter an integer that is bigger or equals to 1.
ORA_GROUP_RENAME_ERROR: There was an error while changing the name of the user group. Please reload the current form and try again. If this error should persist, please contact our support.
GROUP_CREATE_NAME_HINT: Please keep in mind, that all members of a group have to enter the group name on each login. It should neither be complicated nor long.
SHARE_WITH_USER: Share your program with another user ...
SHARE_WITH_USERGROUP: Share your program with the members of one of your user groups ...
DATATABLE_USERGROUP_NAME_CREATE_HINT: The name of the user group. Kepp in mind, that the members will have to type it in each time they log in.
DATATABLE_USERGROUP_OWNER: Name of the owner of the user group
USERGROUP_CREATE_TOOLTIP: Click here to create a new usergroup
USERGROUP_LIST_DELETE_TOOLTIP: Click here to delete the user group.
USERGROUP_LIST_DELETE_ALL_TOOLTIP: Click here to delete all selected user groups.
USERGROUP_MEMBER_CREATE_TOOLTIP: Click here to add members to your usergroup.
USERGROUP_MEMBER_LIST_DELETE_TOOLTIP: Click here to delete this user group member.
USERGROUP_MEMBER_LIST_DELETE_ALL_TOOLTIP: Click here to delete all selected user group members.
USERGROUP_MEMBER_LIST_RESET_PASSWORD_TOO: Click here to reset the password of this user group member to the default password.
USERGROUP_MEMBER_LIST_RESET_ALL_PASSWORD: Click here to reset the password of all selected user group members to their corresponding default password.
USERGROUP_MEMBER_DEFAULT_PASSWORD_HINT: The password for your account is not safe. Set your own password, so that only you can login to your account.
USERGROUP_LOGIN_LOST_PASSWORD_HINT: If you forgot your password, you can ask the owner of your user group to reset the password to the initial password for you. It will be the password you had to enter when you logged in first.
USERGROUP_NAME_HINT: The user group to which you want to log in has a name. Enter it here.
HINT_USERGROUP_OWNER: Do not enter the real name of the owner of the user group here, but his username instead.
HINT_USERGROUP_MEMBER: Enter the member id of your user here.
DELETE_USERGROUP_MEMBER_WARNING: Are you sure that you want to delete the selected member(s)?
DELETE_USERGROUP_MEMBER_AFTER_LOGIN_WARN: A member you want to delete did already log in and might have create own programs. Are you sure that you want to delete the selected member(s)?
SHARE_PROGRAMS_USERGROUP_HINT: To share programs with a user group, open your program list and share a program with a user group.
ORA_USER_UPDATE_ERROR_NOT_SAVED_TO_DB: The password could not be saved to the database. Are you sure that you entered the old password correctly?
USERGROUP_DELETE_WITH_MEMBERS_WARNING: Are your sure that you want to delete the usergroup including all members? No member did log in so far.
ORA_PROGRAM_GET_ALL_ERROR_USER_NOT_FOUND: Can not load the programs of the specified user. Please reload the lab and try again.
ORA_USER_DELETE_ERROR_HAS_GROUPS: You have user groups associated with your account. Please delete them first, before you delete your account.
ORA_USER_ERROR_NOT_LOGGED_IN: You need to be logged in to a user account to use this function. If you are logged in, please log out and in again.
USERGROUP_GENERATED_MEMBERS_TOOLTIP: Automatically genertated members are normal members of a user group. They are generated with a number as username, which you can change afterwards.
MATH_CAST_TOSTRING_TOOLTIP: Convert this number into a string.
MATH_CAST_TOCHAR_TOOLTIP: Convert this number into a single ASCII character
TEXT_CAST_CHAR_TONUMBER_TOOLTIP: Convert the character at the given position in this string into the corresponding ASCII number. The first character in the string is at position 0!
TEXT_CAST_STRING_TONUMBER_TOOLTIP: Convert this string into a number, if it contains a number.
SENSOR_ENVIRONMENTAL_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Returns values from the environmental sensor.
AIFES_SETUP_TOOLTIP: define properties of a neural network, which can classify data
AIFES_INIT_RAW_DATA_TOOLTIP: clear raw data memory. Then add raw data multiple times, extract the input features from it and add that to the trainings data
AIFES_INIT_CLASSIFY_DATA_TOOLTIP: clear classify data memory. Then add raw data multiple times, extract the input features from it and add that to the classify data
AIFES_ADD_RAW_DATA_TOOLTIP: add training data (multiple times). Then extract the input features from it and add that to the trainings data
AIFES_ADD_CLASSIFY_DATA_TOOLTIP: add classify data (multiple times). Then extract the input features from it and add that to the classifiy data
AIFES_ADD_TARGET_DATA_TOOLTIP: take raw data, execute feature extraction and add the data from feature extraction to the collection of training data for a class
AIFES_TRAIN_TOOLTIP: train the neural network with the trainings data assembled
AIFES_CLASSIFY_TOOLTIP: use the trained neural network and data from feature extraction to classify and return the probabiliy for each class
NN_STEP_TOOLTIP: retrieve inputs values, execute one step in a neural network, generate values of the output neurons
NN_SET_WEIGHT_TOOLTIP: change the weight between two neurons.
NN_SET_BIAS_TOOLTIP: change the bias of a neuron.
NN_GET_WEIGHT_TOOLTIP: return the value of the weight between two connected neurons.
NN_GET_BIAS_TOOLTIP: return the value of the bias of a neuron.
NN_SET_INPUT_NEURON_VALUE_TOOLTIP: set the value of an input neuron for the next step of the neural network.
NN_GET_OUTPUT_NEURON_VALUE_TOOLTIP: return the value of an output neuron from the last step of the neural network.
NN_CLICK_WEIGHT_BIAS: change by clicking on weight or bias
NN_CLICK_NODE: select node by clicking, then change
POPUP_BACKGROUND_REPLACE:
A program with the same name already exists.
Would you like to replace it?
POPUP_BACKGROUND_REPLACE_CONFIGURATION:
A configuration with the same name already exists.
Would you like to replace it?
POPUP_ABOUT_TEXT_NRW: As part of the project »AI Algorithms in Computer Science Education«, the Ministry for Schools and Education of the State of North Rhine-Westphalia is funding the integration of Artificial Neural Networks into the Open Roberta Lab as well as the development of suitable learning content and materials on Artificial Intelligence.
SENSOR_IRHORIZONTAL_GETSAMPLE_TOOLTIP: Gets the current reading from the infrared sensor.
MATH_THYMIO_TRIG_TOOLTIP: All trigonometric functions map the angles [-pi, pi] radians to [-32768, 32767]. The resultant sin and cos values are similarly mapped, namely [-1.0, 1.0] to [-32768, 32767].
MOTOR_TOOLTIP_SPIKE: Represents a middle or large angular motor.
DISPLAY_TOOLTIP_SPIKE: Represents a screen with a 5 x 5 LED matrix.
